intro: Micromeria helianthemifolia var. mary-annae, commonly known as Mary-Anne's micromeria, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a low-growing shrub characterized by its aromatic, glandular leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or coastal environments. Its small, fragrant flowers bloom in the spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The variety is named in honor of Mary-Anne, likely a botanist or horticulturist who contributed to its study or cultivation.
